meanings.sent1: We need to vamose before the storm hits.
meanings.sent2: The cat decided to vamose when it saw the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent3: The cookies in the jar seemed to vamose when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The idea of going to the dentist made him vamose from the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician made the rabbit vamose from the hat in a blink of an eye.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to express departure.
meanings.sent1: Vamose! I have to catch the last bus.
meanings.sent2: He shouted 'vamose' as he ran to catch the train.
meanings.sent3: Vamose! The party is over, folks.
meanings.sent4: The kids yelled 'vamose' as they ran out of the classroom.
meanings.sent5: Vamose! Let's make a quick exit before they notice we're gone.
